postsData.name:
Keith Sconiers
Keith Sconiers
postsData.content:
Your dream isn’t within your current zip code.

You have to travel.

Be willing to do things you don’t want to do.

Meet strangers.

Sell.

Risk rejection.

Change.

Meet more strangers.

Until they become colleagues.

Networking when you’d rather sit at home.

Doing things you don’t like doing so you can earn the right to do what you want to do.

There isn’t an easy way forward.

No middle ground.

Enduring the pain of the process.

We will either go all in on living our purpose or we won’t.

Go all…

IN.

Let’s Talk:

comments.commentText: Keith Sconiers All in, or nothing!  Time to live our purpose.
Carlos Hicks Jr. let’s goo!!!

postsData.commentAdded: 💪 Absolutely! Embracing discomfort is essential for growth. Lets step outside our comfort zones and chase our dreams together! 🚀 #Networking #Growth

postsData.name:
Neil Sahota
Neil Sahota
postsData.content:
AI isn’t just another software; it’s a transformative force.

Unlike traditional tools, AI can learn, adapt, and evolve.

It processes vast amounts of data to uncover patterns and insights humans might miss, making it a powerful ally in decision-making and problem-solving.

The key to unlocking AI's true potential lies in embracing its capacity to augment human intelligence, not replace it.

We can achieve once unimaginable breakthroughs when we harness AI to enhance creativity, efficiency, and innovation.

It’s not just software, it’s a game-changer.


To watch the entire Human-AI Symbiosis with  Cedric Chin and Lia DiBello Ph.D on the Commoncog podcast, click here -

comments.commentText: Trust in AI is just as important as its capabilities.

postsData.name:
Tanner Smith
Tanner Smith
postsData.content:
Stop educating your customers.

They already know what they need.

Nobody wants another lesson about your industry.

They want to know if you understand their problem.

I’ve worked with brands who wasted time explaining what they do.

Instead of showing they understand who they serve.

Here's what your customers really want to know:

• Have you solved their exact problem before?
• Do you speak their language?
• Can you name their pain points?

Anything beyond that is noise.

Nike doesn't teach you about shoes.

Neither does Apple explain computers.

Unless you've invented time travel, your industry isn't new.

Your customers aren't clueless.

They just need to see themselves in your story.

Focus on connection, not education.

comments.commentText: This is well said which as few as words possible. Love this!!!

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Its all about understanding your customer and their needs. Connection builds trust far more than mere education ever could!

postsData.name:
Garett Moreau 🇺🇸
Garett Moreau 🇺🇸
postsData.content:
NATIONAL SECURITY: The U.S. Navy has instructed service members to avoid using the Chinese AI platform DeepSeek, citing "potential security and ethical concerns," according to CNBC.

An email sent to "shipmates" referenced the Navy's AI policy and emphasized the importance of refraining from using DeepSeek.

The memo warned service members against using the platform "for any work-related tasks or personal use" and instructed them to "avoid downloading, installing, or using the DeepSeek model in any capacity."

The warning follows the recent rise of DeepSeek’s R1 model, which has demonstrated capabilities comparable to OpenAI’s models. In December, DeepSeek claimed it had successfully trained a large language model in just two months at a cost of $6 million despite U.S. restrictions on semiconductor chip exports to China.

The R1, an open-source model, surged to the top of Apple’s app store rankings this week, triggering a market sell-off. Shares of AI chipmakers Nvidia and Broadcom plummeted by 17% on Monday, wiping out a combined $800 billion in market value. Nvidia has since recovered some of its losses.

comments.commentText: No worries. I bet the servers in the nuclear subs can be shut down by the Chinese with the click of a mouse. We are not a nuclear superpower anymore. We just have expensive paper weights. My humble opinion of course.
GMTY Garett Moreau 🇺🇸

postsData.commentAdded: Its crucial to prioritize security in tech adoption. The Navys caution highlights the balance between innovation and safeguarding integrity.

postsData.name:
Neil Weitzman
Neil Weitzman
postsData.content:
NEVER had this happen to me before. I guess there is a first time for everything - check out this reaction to a reference.

A member ofwas interviewing for a job.

I thought maybe I could be helpful for this person and offered to send to quick note/referral to a few of the people that they met with during the interview process.

I sent the attached to 4 people - quick, simple and just vouching for this person who I know quite well.

1 person responded with a very nice message thanking me.

1 person responded with "noted"

1 person did not respond at all.

1 person told me It was very wrong for me to have done this - see image.

"𝘐 𝘧𝘪𝘯𝘥 𝘪𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘶𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘰𝘸 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘬 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘢 𝘳𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘢𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘮𝘱𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘫𝘦𝘤𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘰𝘱𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘯. 𝘐 𝘥𝘪𝘥𝘯'𝘵 𝘢𝘴𝘬 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘪𝘵, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨, 𝘳𝘦𝘨𝘢𝘳𝘥𝘭𝘦𝘴𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘳𝘥. 𝘐𝘯𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘰𝘯 𝘴𝘰 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘭𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘭𝘴."


Anyone ever get this reaction?

I have sent hundreds of notes like this for people over the years and this was the absolute FIRST time anyone ever reacted like this.

-

comments.commentText: Hi Neil, just taking a different angle than the comments here. It might have been that his person gotten critical feedback why he/she hasn’t hired anyone yet, with that emotion read your referral and responded in his/her own emotion to your well-intended message. Sometimes the emotion you receive does not come from your message. I would, just like you mentioned here, want to have a chat with the person to understand. Maybe reach out in a few days when the height of emotions was worn off. By all means, your message is not wrong.
great feedback Marcella

postsData.name:
Marianna Outsia
Marianna Outsia
postsData.content:
Weekend Vibes:  
Recharge, Reflect, and Reconnect
Sometimes, life reminds us to slow down and 
savor the moment.

It’s the first Saturday of February,

and instead of winter’s gloom,

we’re gifted with sunshine,

clear skies,

and temperatures above 15°C.

It’s the perfect opportunity to step outside,

embrace nature, and recharge.


This weekend,

I’m spending time

in the beautiful coastal town of Nafpaktos,

a place rich in history and charm.


Its iconic castle and picturesque harbor

are reminders of the serenity

and beauty that surround us.

Take a moment this weekend to:

• Soak up the sun 
• Go for a walk in nature ‍️
• Reconnect with family and loved ones ️
• Breathe deeply, recharge your mind, and nurture your well-being 

Every weekend is a chance to reset

and prepare for the week ahead.

Use it wisely.

How are you spending your weekend?

postsData.name:
Geetika Saigal
Geetika Saigal
postsData.content:
Your Brand Is Boring Without a Story
Here’s How to Fix It:

Most people think branding is about colors, logos, and a fancy website.

But let me tell you something… branding is storytelling.

You can have the best-looking brand in the world, but if your story doesn’t connect, no one will care.

Here are 3 storytelling tips that will make your brand unforgettable:

1️⃣ Stop Talking About You, Start Talking About Them

Nobody cares about your company’s journey until they see themselves in it. Make your customer the hero, and show how you help them win.

2️⃣ Show, Don’t Just Tell

Saying “We provide the best service” is boring. Instead, tell a story: “Last week, a client came to us frustrated after wasting thousands on the wrong strategy.

In two weeks, we turned things around, and they finally saw real results.” Now, that’s powerful.

3️⃣ Make It Personal

People connect with people, not businesses. Share your struggles, your wins, your real journey. The more human your brand feels, the stronger the connection.

 P.S. I’ve built brands through storytelling for years, and trust me, this works. If you’re ready to build a brand people actually remember, DM me.

comments.commentText: Great points on the power of storytelling! What’s the first step you recommend for a brand looking to shift from selling a product to telling a story?
I love the idea of sharing real-life examples to demonstrate impact

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely love this perspective! Storytelling is key to creating authentic connections. Let’s make brands relatable and memorable! 🌟

postsData.name:
Michael Ocean
Michael Ocean
postsData.content:
From door-to-door scripts to enterprise frameworks: evolution of a sales professional


I recently had an awesome conversation with(Fractional Head of Sales for early stage startups, ex-Shopify, ex-Oracle, ex-IBM). He did something fascinating - demonstrated his exact door-to-door pitch from Vivint from 8 years ago, then broke down IBM's Global Sales School framework live on the show!


Key takeaways from our chat:

- Role-playing remains the #1 training method across organizations of all sizes
- Why understanding buyer personas matter more than product pitches
- How early-stage startups can learn from enterprise training programs (and vice versa)


The most fascinating part? Hearing Ryan literally reconstruct his sales evolution - from memorized scripts at Vivint to sophisticated frameworks at IBM. His example opening at IBM was gold: combining personal story (door-to-door experience) with business value to create instant credibility.


In the full episode, we covered:

- Vivint's intensive door-to-door training program
- IBM's legendary Global Sales School experience
- The stark differences between startup vs enterprise sales training
- Why understanding customer problems beats knowing product features
- Key mistakes founders make when hiring their first sales rep


One of the most fun & tactical episodes I've recorded.

Check out the full conversation in the comments

postsData.name:
Rodney Steele
Rodney Steele
postsData.content:
What does a Con man, a clueless Competitor and a Client who didn’t know best …

More than you think.

In business, partnerships can be magical—like peanut butter and jelly, or Netflix and snacks.

But every so often, you swipe right on a total disaster.

Here are three times I learned that not all partnerships are created equal:

1. The Referral Partner Who Sold Handbooks Using Our Name

Picture this: a referral partner starts throwing our name around to sell handbooks.

When I called them out, they hit me with, “Oh, that was a mistake.”

Sure, and I accidentally ate an entire cake last week. Then, because things weren’t weird enough, they tried to extort us for money to “fix it.”

The lesson?

If someone’s ethics are sketchy from the start, run. Integrity matters, and bad partners can tank your reputation faster than a bad Yelp review.

2. The Competitor Who Wanted Us to Review Their Code

A competitor came to us asking if we’d review their code to see if it “made sense.”

Translation: “Please do our homework for free.”

The lesson?

If someone’s offer sounds too one-sided, it’s because it is.

Partnerships should be win-win, not win-“we take all your time and ideas.”

3. The Client Who Took Our Advice, Left, and Then Came Crawling Back

We had a client who loved our advice. So much so, they took everything we created for them, jumped ship to another company, and used it all.

Then, as if that wasn’t bold enough, they came back later asking us to help them sell their product.

The lesson?

Just because you’re good at what you do doesn’t mean you have to help everyone.

Invest your time in people who actually value your expertise—and aren’t going to ghost you like a bad date.

Here’s the Deal:

Partnerships are like relationships—they only work if there’s mutual respect, trust, and some semblance of common sense.

Shortcuts and shady moves might get quick wins, but they’ll burn out faster than my New Year’s resolutions.

What’s the wildest partnership story you’ve experienced?

Let’s hear it—I could use the laugh.

comments.commentText: Great post  Partnerships truly can be magical when they work, but oh boy, when they don’t, it’s like watching a train wreck in slow motion.  there has to mutual respect and trust. Give and take. Otherwise it dies a natural death. ‍️
Brion Carroll (II) that’s right. They can be blessings or curses.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Its a reminder that partnerships thrive on integrity and mutual respect. Cheers to finding the right match! 🎉

postsData.name:
Christine Carrillo
Christine Carrillo
postsData.content:
Always 'on' isn't commitment. It's quiet self-sabotage.

You're building an empire.
But what's crumbling while you build?

The real cost:

Your kid's recital was last week
Your partner stopped sharing their day
Your last health check-up..."Next quarter"

The greatest lie in entrepreneurship:

Success requires sacrificing everything else.

7 boundaries that save empires (and lives)

1. Kill Your Hero Complex
→ Saving every crisis creates more crises
→ Let small fires burn, protect what matters

2. Power Hours
→ Your best energy isn't for email
→ Two hours for deep work. No meetings before 10am.

3. Digital Sunset
→ Slack/email stop at 6pm
→ Your team will adapt (and respect you more)

4. Delegate Authority
→ Stop being the bottleneck
→ Train leaders to decide without you

5. Fully Disconnect Quarterly
→ Exhausted leaders make expensive mistakes
→ Schedule quarterly vacations for the next year

6. Define Your Own Success
→ Build your dream, not someone else's
→ Include what it feels like when you've reached it

7. Health Non-Negotiables
→ Your health isn't a quarterly goal
→ Daily movement, 7 hours sleep, real food

Your legacy isn't just your business.
It's the lives you touch while building it.
It's living the life you've worked hard to build.

Start with one boundary.
Guard it fiercely.
Watch what opens up.

Which boundary will you protect?

️ Repost to help someone
 Followfor more

comments.commentText: Great reminder Christine. Building an empire at the cost of everything else is the quiet kind of self-sabotage that chips away at what truly matters. I always encourage leaders to set clear boundaries, from digital sunsets to protecting their health.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

comments.commentText: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor just one boundary at a time. Build from there. Well said, Damesha.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Prioritizing boundaries is essential for sustainable success. I’m starting with “Health Non-Negotiables” this quarter! 💪✨

postsData.name:
Sonia Hunt
Sonia Hunt
postsData.content:
Does everyone have longevity wrong?


Longevity isn’t just about living longer—
It’s about thriving for the long haul.

𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲’𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀:
You can’t lead a thriving business,
if you’re not thriving yourself.

I learned this the hard way:
-Lifetime of chronic conditions.
-4x in anaphylaxis almost dead on an ER table.

When I biohacked into remission from 32+ food allergies,
I realized I wasn’t just healing—
I was building a blueprint for longevity.

𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝟱 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀 𝗜 𝗱𝗼 𝗱𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴:
(i'm not injecting myself with the blood of a 20-year old )

1. 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻 𝗔𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗠𝘆 𝗕𝗼𝗱𝘆.
-Testing & Tracking key health metrics regularly to learn.
→Understanding my body helps optimize performance and catch early signs of imbalance.

𝟮. 𝗣𝗿𝗶𝗼𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗡𝘂𝘁𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻.
-Cook 98% of my food, eating clean for energy and mental clarity.
→Fueling my body the right way leads to better decisions and leadership.

𝟯. 𝗠𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘆 𝗪𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻.
-Block time for different types of movement that boost resilience.
→Movement is medicine—it sharpens the mind and reduces stress.

𝟰. 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗠𝘆 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲.
-Schedule rest & sleep as if it’s a meeting—it’s non-negotiable.
→Sleep and downtime are where clarity and creativity are born.

𝟱. 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝘂𝗿𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗲.

-Thriving businesses start with thriving leaders.

Longevity isn’t just about the years you add to your life—
𝗜𝘁’𝘀 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀.

𝗜𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗿𝗲 𝗮 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗮𝘀𝗸 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳:
Are you building a business that thrives while sacrificing your health?

OR are you leading with the energy to sustain your vision long-term?

--
 I'm Sonia, CEO of. We help ventures scale sustainably.

I write about the intersection of health, leadership, and venture building.

Dieter Wolf 🖥️
Dieter Wolf 🖥️
postsData.content:
If you or your team ever work with complex Excel spreadsheets, you’ll know how easy it is to overlook out-of-date values. This is especially true if you’re using Manual Calculation mode to avoid performance issues.

Well, Microsoft's offering a helping hand.

The new Stale Value Formatting feature in Excel for Windows lets you know when a cell’s value is no longer reliable and needs to be recalculated.

How? It places a warning icon next to the cell and strikes through the outdated value. It’s a handy little reminder that says, “Hey, this data might not be accurate anymore”.

For businesses, this could be big. Whether you’re working on financial models, inventory tracking, or project timelines, you need your numbers to be spot-on. This feature could help you avoid expensive mistakes, making sure your team keep working with reliable data even in the most complex spreadsheets.

It should be available now in Microsoft 365. So keep an eye out for it.

How often do you double-check your spreadsheet values? Could this feature save you some headaches?
postsData.commentAdded: This is a game-changer for data accuracy! Excited to see how the Stale Value Formatting feature improves our spreadsheet workflows.

postsData.name:
Leonard Rodman, M.Sc. PMP® LSSBB® CSM® CSPO®
Leonard Rodman, M.Sc. PMP® LSSBB® CSM® CSPO®
postsData.content:
Keep Your Home and Office Sparkling with These Cleaning Tips 

A clean space means a clear mind!

Use these simple and effective cleaning tips to make your home and office fresh, tidy, and stress-free.

 Tip 1: Declutter Before You Clean
Before you start cleaning, remove unnecessary items from your space. Toss out trash, organize paperwork into piles, and put away stray objects. This makes it easier to clean surfaces properly without distractions.

 Tip 2: Start from the Top
Always clean from the top down—dust ceiling fans, shelves, and light fixtures first so debris falls to the floor. Then, move on to furniture and finish with vacuuming or mopping the floors. This method saves time by avoiding double work.

 Tip 3: Divide and Conquer
Break your cleaning into zones. For your desk, create separate areas for computer work and non-computer tasks. Use trays or containers to organize papers, pens, and miscellaneous items. In your home, tackle one room at a time for a more focused approach.

 Tip 4: Bundle Tasks with Daily Activities
Combine cleaning with other routines to make it easier. For example, wipe down your bathroom sink after brushing your teeth or clean your kitchen counters while waiting for coffee to brew. Small tasks add up over time!

 Tip 5: Use the Right Tools
Invest in microfiber cloths—they’re versatile and can clean almost any surface with just water or vinegar. Keep a small vacuum handy for quick cleanups of crumbs or pet hair in between deep cleans.

 Tip 6: Disinfect High-Touch Areas
Regularly sanitize doorknobs, light switches, keyboards, and phones—especially in shared spaces like offices. Use disinfectant wipes or sprays to reduce germs and keep everyone healthy.

 Tip 7: Make Your Windows Shine
Use a squeegee for streak-free windows and mirrors. Spray with a mix of water and dish soap, then wipe clean with the squeegee for a professional finish. Bonus: coffee filters also work great for spot-free glass!

 Tip 8: Stay on Top of Pet Hair
If you have pets, use a lint roller on furniture or rubber gloves to pick up hair easily. For carpets, a damp rubber squeegee works wonders before vacuuming to grab stubborn fur.

 Tip 9: Keep Cleaning Supplies Handy
Store cleaning supplies in multiple areas of your home or office—like under sinks or in closets—so you can quickly grab what you need without hunting them down. Convenience is key!

 Tip 10: Set a Cleaning Schedule
Consistency is everything! Create a weekly plan for tasks like vacuuming, dusting, and wiping surfaces. Daily habits like making your bed or tidying up after meals help maintain order without overwhelming deep-cleaning sessions later on.

 Follow me for more cleaning hacks!

 Share this post to help others keep their spaces spotless!

comments.commentText: Consistency is key, as you mentioned! Setting a cleaning schedule has helped me maintain a tidy space without spending hours cleaning at once.

postsData.commentAdded: Great tips! A tidy space truly boosts productivity. Love the idea of bundling cleaning with daily routines! 🌟 #CleanSpaces #Productivity

Individuals entering the multiverse should know and understand. 

1. Respect the laws of each universe or dimension: Each universe and dimension has its own laws and principles, respect and abide by them at all times.
2. Do not interfere with the natural order of any universe or dimension: Interfering with the natural order can cause unforeseen consequences and disruptions in the multiverse.

3. Respect the inhabitants and cultures of each reality.

4. Respect and maintain the equilibrium of the multiverse: The equilibrium of the multiverse is delicate and must be preserved at all times.

5. Do not seek power or dominance over others: Using your power for personal gain or domination of others is strictly prohibited.

6. Do not exploit the resources or inhabitants of any universe or dimension: Exploiting and depleting resources or manipulating inhabitants without their consent is forbidden.

7. Treat all living beings and sentient creatures with respect and kindness. Discrimination, prejudice, and abuse are forbidden.

8. Refrain from bringing technology, knowledge from one universe to another unless the destination universe has reached the same level of technological.

9. Refrain from meddling with historical or cosmic events.

postsData.content:
Unlock Success: 5 Reasons to Create Highly Engaged Teams 

In today’s competitive landscape, the strength of your team can make or break your organization. Highly engaged teams are not only more productive but also drive innovation and foster a positive workplace culture. Here are the 5 Reasons You Need to Focus on Creating Highly Engaged Teams:

 Trusting Building trust within your team creates a foundation of reliability and openness. When team members trust each other, collaboration flourishes, and everyone feels secure in sharing ideas and feedback.

 Empowered Empowering your team members gives them the autonomy to take initiative and make decisions. Empowered employees are more confident, take ownership of their work, and contribute meaningfully to the organization’s goals.

 Accountable Highly engaged teams understand their responsibilities and hold themselves accountable for their performance. Accountability ensures that goals are met efficiently and fosters a sense of pride and accomplishment among team members.

 Motivated Motivation drives passion and dedication. Engaged employees are more enthusiastic about their work, leading to higher levels of creativity, persistence, and a willingness to go the extra mile to achieve success.

 Successful The culmination of trust, empowerment, accountability, and motivation leads to overall team success. Successful teams achieve their objectives, drive business growth, and create a thriving work environment that attracts and retains top talent.

 Why It Matters: Creating a highly engaged team not only enhances productivity but also cultivates a positive and resilient workplace culture. Engaged teams are better equipped to navigate challenges, adapt to changes, and sustain long-term success.

 Ready to Elevate Your Team’s Engagement? Visitfor more insights, strategies, and resources on building and maintaining highly engaged teams!

 Let’s Connect: How do you foster engagement within your team? Share your strategies and experiences in the comments below!

 Like,  Comment, and  Share if you found this valuable!

postsData.content:
Yapay zeka yarışında kim öne geçecek?

Şirketlerin sadece %1’i yapay zekada olgunluğa ulaşmış olsa da, %92’si yatırımlarını artırmayı planlıyor. Ancak bu dönüşümü erken kavrayıp uygulayanlar büyük avantaj sağlayacak.

 Şirketler Ne Yapıyor?
• %47’si, yapay zekanın işlerin %30’unu değiştireceğini düşünüyor.
• %71’i, etik kullanım konusunda şirketlerine güveniyor.
• %13’ü, yapay zekayı günlük işlerinde aktif kullanıyor.

 Yapay Zeka ve Gelir Artışı
• %87’si, önümüzdeki 3 yılda gelirlerini artıracağını düşünüyor.
• %51’i, bu büyümenin %5’in üzerinde olacağını öngörüyor.
• Ancak şu anda sadece %19’u bu etkiyi hissediyor.

 Kuşaklar Arası Farklar
• Y Kuşağı (35-44 yaş): %62’si yapay zeka araçlarında uzman.
• Z Kuşağı: %50’si kendini yeterli hissediyor.
• Baby Boomer’lar: Sadece %22’si yapay zekaya hazır.

 Sonuç: Eğitim ve stratejiye yatırım yapanlar kazanacak, bekleyenler ise geride kalacak!

———

️ Bu içeriği paylaşarak siz de "şirketlerin yapay zekaya uyum sağlamasına" destek olun!

 Önce Kafa Yapın Sonra Hayatın Değişir! "Girişimci Kafasıyla Düşün" kitabıyla kafa yapınızı değiştirin:

postsData.content:
Success isn’t achieved through avoiding failure.

It's the result of learning from every setback.

5 Lessons from Famous Failures:

1. Michael Jordan’s Missed Shots

Jordan missed 12,345 shots in his career.
These misses taught him resilience.

Every missed shot was a lesson.
He kept working, never giving up.

2. Federer’s Win Rate

Federer has a 54% win rate.
Even legends lose often.

He studies his losses.
Improves from each one.

3. Serena’s Lost Finals

Serena lost 10 finals.
These losses taught her stamina and strategy.

She learned to adapt.
She persisted through setbacks.

4. Sugar Ray Robinson’s Early Defeats

Robinson faced early defeats.
These stripped him of arrogance.

He sharpened his focus.
Each defeat made him stronger.

5. Ronaldo’s Penalty Misses

Ronaldo missed penalties.
He learned to ignore pressure.

Every miss was a training.
He kept pushing forward.

Greatness isn’t born from wins.

comments.commentText: You can't go far if you don't know how to handle failures that come your way Anisha Jain

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Each failure is a stepping stone to success. Learning from setbacks fuels growth and resilience. Inspired by these legends! 🌟

postsData.name:
Cindy Rayfield
Cindy Rayfield
postsData.content:
️ 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗴𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗟𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗶𝗱𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗙𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 ️

Ready to jump into franchise ownership? Before you sign anything, make sure you understand the legal landscape!

Here are the essentials:

 𝗙𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗗𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗗𝗼𝗰𝘂𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 (𝗙𝗗𝗗): This document is your bible! It contains vital information about the franchisor, fees, obligations, and more. Read it carefully! 
 𝗙𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗔𝘁𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗻𝗲𝘆: A lawyer specializing in franchising can help you navigate the FDD and Franchise Agreement, protecting your interests. 
 𝗙𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗔𝗴𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁: This legally binding contract outlines your rights, responsibilities, and the terms of your agreement with the franchisor. Understand every clause! ️

Don't let legal complexities scare you away from franchising!

With the right knowledge and guidance, you can confidently pursue your dream of business ownership.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Understanding the legalities of franchising is crucial for success. Knowledge is power in business ownership! 🚀 #FranchiseSmart

postsData.name:
Stanford University Graduate School of Business
Stanford University Graduate School of Business
postsData.content:
While online learning has revolutionized education, “providing access to millions of learners worldwide,” Mudit Goel, MS ’24, says it’s missing something critical: human connection.

More and more education is going digital. Goel notes that 60% of U.S. college students took at least one online course in 2021. But he sees a fundamental flaw in the current approach. "You're all by yourself, lonely, confused, helpless," he says, describing the isolation many online learners face. With dropout rates between 40–80%, "this cannot be the approach."

"Education is a great vehicle to bring people together," says Goel, who founded a coding school in India that has taught millions of students. Most people meet their closest friends through school or college, he notes, but online learning often fails to foster these crucial relationships. "This is a huge missed opportunity, not just in terms of academics, but also human connections."

The solution, Goel believes, lies in making online learning more social and interactive, using technology like
to facilitate group discussions and provide personalized feedback at scale. "No matter how intelligent a machine becomes, it cannot replace human presence," he says, "but it can help scale it," transforming a cold, lonely experience into something more connected and meaningful.

This video is from LOWkeynotes: Student presentations on ideas that change lives, organizations, and the world.
postsData.commentAdded: Incredible insights, Mudit! Transforming online learning to foster human connections is essential for student success and engagement. Let’s keep innovating!

postsData.name:
Dheeraj Sharma
Dheeraj Sharma
postsData.content:
Your skills can open doors, but your behavior determines how long you stay inside.


Bold Opinion:-
Talent may set you apart, but your behavior is what truly makes you stand out.

I once met two equally skilled professionals. One was respected for their kindness and integrity, the other struggled due to their attitude. It was a reminder that behavior shapes success. Here’s how to refine yours:

1. Be respectful, always. How you treat others matters.


2. Stay humble. Growth comes from learning.


3. Communicate with empathy. Understand before reacting.


4. Lead with integrity. Trust is earned, not given.

What behavior do you think defines true success?

comments.commentText: Very well said  the way we treat others defines our true impact

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Kindness and integrity create lasting relationships. Success flourishes in a respectful and empathetic environment. What a great reminder!
